name: GMAIL_ADD_LABEL_TO_EMAIL
description: Adds and/or removes specified gmail labels for a message; ensure `message id` and all `label ids` are valid (use 'listlabels' for custom label ids).

add_label_ids.description: Label IDs to add. For custom labels, obtain IDs via 'listLabels'. System labels (e.g., 'INBOX', 'SPAM') can also be used.
add_label_ids.title: Add Label Ids

message_id.description: Immutable ID of the message to modify (e.g., from 'fetchEmails' or 'fetchMessagesByThreadId').
message_id.title: Message Id

remove_label_ids.description: Label IDs to remove. For custom labels, obtain IDs via 'listLabels'. System labels can also be used.
remove_label_ids.title: Remove Label Ids

user_id.description: User's email address or 'me' for the authenticated user.
user_id.title: User Id

name: GMAIL_CREATE_EMAIL_DRAFT
description: Creates a gmail email draft, supporting to/cc/bcc, subject, plain/html body (ensure `is html=true` for html), attachments, and threading.

body.description: Email body content (plain text or HTML); `is_html` must be True if HTML.
examples:
Hello Team,

Please find the attached report for your review.

Best regards,
Your Name

Meeting Confirmation

This email confirms our meeting scheduled for next Tuesday.
body.title: Body

is_html.description: Set to True if `body` is HTML, otherwise the action may fail.
is_html.title: Is Html

thread_id.description: ID of an existing Gmail thread to reply to; omit for new thread.
thread_id.title: Thread Id

user_id.description: User's email address or 'me' for the authenticated user.
user_id.title: User Id

attachment_schema_parsed_file.title: FileUploadable
attachment_schema_parsed_file.description: File to attach to the email.

name: GMAIL_CREATE_LABEL
description: Creates a new label with a unique name in the specified user's gmail account.

label_list_visibility.description: Controls how the label is displayed in the label list in the Gmail sidebar.
label_list_visibility.title: Label List Visibility

label_name.description: The name for the new label.
label_name.title: Label Name

message_list_visibility.description: Controls how messages with this label are displayed in the message list.
message_list_visibility.title: Message List Visibility

user_id.description: The email address of the user in whose account the label will be created.
user_id.title: User Id

name: GMAIL_DELETE_DRAFT
description: Permanently deletes a specific gmail draft using its id; ensure the draft exists and the user has necessary permissions for the given `user id`.

draft_id.description: Immutable ID of the draft to delete, typically obtained when the draft was created.
draft_id.title: Draft Id

user_id.description: User's email address or 'me' for the authenticated user; 'me' is recommended.
user_id.title: User Id

name: GMAIL_DELETE_MESSAGE
description: Permanently deletes a specific email message by its id from a gmail mailbox; for `user id`, use 'me' for the authenticated user or an email address to which the authenticated user has delegated access.

message_id.description: Identifier of the email message to delete.
message_id.title: Message Id

user_id.description: User's email address. The special value 'me' refers to the authenticated user.
user_id.title: User Id

name: GMAIL_FETCH_EMAILS
description: Fetches a list of email messages from a gmail account, supporting filtering, pagination, and optional full content retrieval.

include_payload.description: Set to true to include full message payload (headers, body, attachments); false for metadata only.
include_payload.title: Include Payload

include_spam_trash.description: Set to true to include messages from 'SPAM' and 'TRASH'.
include_spam_trash.title: Include Spam Trash

label_ids.description: Filter by label IDs; only messages with all specified labels are returned. Common IDs: 'INBOX', 'SPAM', 'TRASH', 'UNREAD', 'STARRED', 'IMPORTANT', 'CATEGORY_PERSONAL', 'CATEGORY_SOCIAL', 'CATEGORY_PROMOTIONS', 'CATEGORY_UPDATES', 'CATEGORY_FORUMS'. Use 'listLabels' action for custom IDs.
label_ids.title: Label Ids

max_results.description: Maximum number of messages to retrieve per page.
max_results.title: Max Results

page_token.description: Token for retrieving a specific page, obtained from a previous response's `nextPageToken`. Omit for the first page.
page_token.title: Page Token

query.description: Gmail advanced search query (e.g., 'from:user subject:meeting'). Supports operators like 'from:', 'to:', 'subject:', 'label:', 'has:attachment', 'is:unread', 'after:YYYY/MM/DD', 'before:YYYY/MM/DD', AND/OR/NOT. Use quotes for exact phrases. Omit for no query filter.
query.title: Query

user_id.description: User's email address or 'me' for the authenticated user.
user_id.title: User Id

name: GMAIL_FETCH_MESSAGE_BY_MESSAGE_ID
description: Fetches a specific email message by its id, provided the `message id` exists and is accessible to the authenticated `user id`.

format.description: Format for message content: 'minimal' (ID/labels), 'full' (complete data), 'raw' (base64url string), 'metadata' (ID/labels/headers).
format.title: Format

message_id.description: Unique ID of the email message to retrieve, obtainable from actions like 'List Messages'.
message_id.title: Message Id

user_id.description: User's email address or 'me' for the authenticated user.
user_id.title: User Id

name: GMAIL_FETCH_MESSAGE_BY_THREAD_ID
description: Retrieves messages from a gmail thread using its `thread id`, where the thread must be accessible by the specified `user id`.

page_token.description: Opaque page token for fetching a specific page of messages if results are paginated.
page_token.title: Page Token

thread_id.description: Unique ID of the thread, obtainable from actions like 'listThreads' or 'fetchEmails'.
thread_id.title: Thread Id

user_id.description: The email address of the user.
user_id.title: User Id

name: GMAIL_GET_ATTACHMENT
description: Retrieves a specific attachment by id from a message in a user's gmail mailbox, requiring valid message and attachment ids.

attachment_id.description: ID of the attachment to retrieve.
attachment_id.title: Attachment Id

file_name.description: Desired filename for the downloaded attachment.
file_name.title: File Name

message_id.description: Immutable ID of the message containing the attachment.
message_id.title: Message Id

user_id.description: User's email address ('me' for authenticated user).
user_id.title: User Id

name: GMAIL_GET_CONTACTS
description: Fetches contacts (connections) for the authenticated google account, allowing selection of specific data fields and pagination.

page_token.description: Token to retrieve a specific page of results, obtained from 'nextPageToken' in a previous response.
page_token.title: Page Token

person_fields.description: Comma-separated person fields to retrieve for each contact (e.g., 'names,emailAddresses').
person_fields.title: Person Fields

resource_name.description: Identifier for the person resource whose connections are listed; use 'people/me' for the authenticated user.
resource_name.title: Resource Name

name: GMAIL_GET_PEOPLE
description: Retrieves either a specific person's details (using `resource name`) or lists 'other contacts' (if `other contacts` is true), with `person fields` specifying the data to return.

other_contacts.description: If true, retrieves 'Other Contacts' (people interacted with but not explicitly saved), ignoring `resource_name` and enabling pagination/sync. If false, retrieves information for the single person specified by `resource_name`.
other_contacts.title: Other Contacts

page_size.description: The number of 'Other Contacts' to return per page. Applicable only when `other_contacts` is true.
page_size.title: Page Size

page_token.description: An opaque token from a previous response to retrieve the next page of 'Other Contacts' results. Applicable only when `other_contacts` is true and paginating.
page_token.title: Page Token

person_fields.description: A comma-separated field mask to restrict which fields on the person (or persons) are returned. Consult the Google People API documentation for a comprehensive list of valid fields.
person_fields.title: Person Fields

resource_name.description: Resource name identifying the person for whom to retrieve information (like the authenticated user or a specific contact). Used only when `other_contacts` is false.
resource_name.title: Resource Name

sync_token.description: A token from a previous 'Other Contacts' list call to retrieve only changes since the last sync; leave empty for an initial full sync. Applicable only when `other_contacts` is true.
sync_token.title: Sync Token

name: GMAIL_GET_PROFILE
description: Retrieves key gmail profile information (email address, message/thread totals, history id) for a user.

user_id.description: The email address of the Gmail user whose profile is to be retrieved, or the special value 'me' to indicate the currently authenticated user.
user_id.title: User Id

name: GMAIL_LIST_DRAFTS
description: Retrieves a paginated list of email drafts from a user's gmail account.

max_results.description: Maximum number of drafts to return per page.
max_results.title: Max Results

page_token.description: Token from a previous response to retrieve a specific page of drafts.
page_token.title: Page Token

user_id.description: User's mailbox ID; use 'me' for the authenticated user.
user_id.title: User Id

name: GMAIL_LIST_LABELS
description: Retrieves a list of all system and user-created labels for the specified gmail account.

user_id.description: Identifies the Gmail account (owner's email or 'me' for authenticated user) for which labels will be listed.
user_id.title: User Id

name: GMAIL_LIST_THREADS
description: Retrieves a list of email threads from a gmail account, identified by `user id` (email address or 'me'), supporting filtering and pagination.

max_results.description: Maximum number of threads to return.
max_results.title: Max Results

page_token.description: Token from a previous response to retrieve a specific page of results; omit for the first page.
page_token.title: Page Token

query.description: Filter for threads, using Gmail search query syntax (e.g., 'from:user@example.com is:unread').
query.title: Query

user_id.description: The user's email address or 'me' to specify the authenticated Gmail account.
user_id.title: User Id

name: GMAIL_MODIFY_THREAD_LABELS
description: Adds or removes specified existing label ids from a gmail thread, affecting all its messages; ensure the thread id is valid.

add_label_ids.description: List of label IDs to add to the thread; these labels must exist.
add_label_ids.title: Add Label Ids

remove_label_ids.description: List of label IDs to remove from the thread; these labels must exist.
remove_label_ids.title: Remove Label Ids

thread_id.description: Immutable ID of the thread to modify.
thread_id.title: Thread Id

user_id.description: User's email address or 'me' for the authenticated user.
user_id.title: User Id

name: GMAIL_MOVE_TO_TRASH
description: Moves an existing, non-deleted email message to the trash for the specified user.

message_id.description: Identifier of the email message to move to trash.
message_id.title: Message Id

user_id.description: User's email address or 'me' for the authenticated user.
user_id.title: User Id

name: GMAIL_REMOVE_LABEL
description: Permanently deletes a specific, existing user-created gmail label by its id for a user; cannot delete system labels.

label_id.description: ID of the user-created label to be permanently deleted; must exist and not be a system label.
label_id.title: Label Id

user_id.description: User's email address or 'me' for the authenticated user.
user_id.title: User Id

name: GMAIL_REPLY_TO_THREAD
description: Sends a reply within a specific gmail thread using the original thread's subject, requiring a valid `thread id` and correctly formatted email addresses.

bcc.description: BCC recipients' email addresses (hidden from other recipients).
bcc.title: Bcc

is_html.description: Indicates if `message_body` is HTML; if True, body must be valid HTML, if False, body should not contain HTML tags.
is_html.title: Is Html

message_body.description: Content of the reply message, either plain text or HTML.
examples: Dear Sir, Nice talking to you. Yours respectfully, John
message_body.title: Message Body

thread_id.description: Identifier of the Gmail thread for the reply.
thread_id.title: Thread Id

user_id.description: Identifier for the user sending the reply; 'me' refers to the authenticated user.
user_id.title: User Id

name: GMAIL_SEARCH_PEOPLE
description: Searches contacts by matching the query against names, nicknames, emails, phone numbers, and organizations, optionally including 'other contacts'.

other_contacts.description: Include 'Other Contacts' (interacted with but not explicitly saved) in search results; if false, searches only primary contacts.
other_contacts.title: Other Contacts

pageSize.description: Maximum results to return; values >30 are capped to 30 by the API.
pageSize.title: Page Size

person_fields.description: Comma-separated fields to return (e.g., 'names,emailAddresses'); see PersonFields enum. If 'other_contacts' is true, only 'emailAddresses', 'names', 'phoneNumbers' are allowed.
person_fields.title: Person Fields

query.description: Matches contact names, nicknames, email addresses, phone numbers, and organization fields.
query.title: Query

name: GMAIL_SEND_EMAIL
description: Sends an email via gmail api using the authenticated user's google profile display name, requiring `is html=true` if the body contains html and valid `s3key`, `mimetype`, `name` for any attachment.

bcc.description: Blind Carbon Copy (BCC) recipients' email addresses.
bcc.title: Bcc

body.description: Email content (plain text or HTML); if HTML, `is_html` must be `True`.
examples: Hello team, let's discuss the project updates tomorrow.
body.title: Body

extra_recipients.description: Additional 'To' recipients' email addresses (not Cc or Bcc).
extra_recipients.title: Extra Recipients

is_html.description: Set to `True` if the email body contains HTML tags.
is_html.title: Is Html

user_id.description: User's email address; the literal 'me' refers to the authenticated user.
user_id.title: User Id

attachment_schema_parsed_file.title: FileUploadable
attachment_schema_parsed_file.description: File to attach; ensure `s3key`, `mimetype`, and `name` are set if provided. Omit or set to null for no attachment.

name: GOOGLECALENDAR_CREATE_EVENT
description: Creates an event on a google calendar, needing rfc3339 utc start/end times (end after start) and write access to the calendar.

calendar_id.description: Target calendar: 'primary' for the user's main calendar, or the calendar's email address.
calendar_id.title: Calendar Id

create_meeting_room.description: If true, a Google Meet link is created and added to the event. CRITICAL: As of 2024, this REQUIRES a paid Google Workspace account ($13+/month). Personal Gmail accounts will fail with 'Invalid conference type value' error. Solutions: 1) Upgrade to Workspace, 2) Use domain-wide delegation with Workspace user, 3) Use the new Google Meet REST API, or 4) Create events without conferences. See https://github.com/googleapis/google-api-nodejs-client/issues/3234
create_meeting_room.title: Create Meeting Room

description.description: Description of the event. Can contain HTML. Optional.
description.title: Description

eventType.description: Type of the event, immutable post-creation. Currently, only 'default' and 'workingLocation' can be created.
eventType.title: Event Type

event_duration_hour.description: Number of hours (0-24). Increase by 1 here rather than passing 60 in `event_duration_minutes`
event_duration_hour.title: Event Duration Hour

event_duration_minutes.description: Number of minutes (0-59). Make absolutely sure this is less than 60.
event_duration_minutes.title: Event Duration Minutes

guestsCanInviteOthers.description: Whether attendees other than the organizer can invite others to the event.
guestsCanInviteOthers.title: Guests Can Invite Others

guestsCanSeeOtherGuests.description: Whether attendees other than the organizer can see who the event's attendees are.
guestsCanSeeOtherGuests.title: Guests Can See Other Guests

guests_can_modify.description: If True, guests can modify the event.
guests_can_modify.title: Guests Can Modify

location.description: Geographic location of the event as free-form text.
location.title: Location

recurrence.description: List of RRULE, EXRULE, RDATE, EXDATE lines for recurring events.
recurrence.title: Recurrence

send_updates.description: Defaults to True. Whether to send updates to the attendees.
send_updates.title: Send Updates

start_datetime.description: Naive date/time (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS) with NO offsets or Z. e.g. '2025-01-16T13:00:00'
start_datetime.title: Start Datetime

timezone.description: IANA timezone name (e.g., 'America/New_York'). Required if datetime is naive. If datetime includes timezone info (Z or offset), this field is optional and defaults to UTC.
timezone.title: Timezone

name: GOOGLECALENDAR_DELETE_EVENT
description: Deletes a specified event by `event id` from a google calendar (`calendar id`); this action is idempotent and raises a 404 error if the event is not found.

calendar_id.description: Identifier of the Google Calendar (e.g., email address, specific ID, or 'primary' for the authenticated user's main calendar) from which the event will be deleted.
calendar_id.title: Calendar Id

event_id.description: Unique identifier of the event to delete, typically obtained upon event creation.
event_id.title: Event Id

name: GOOGLECALENDAR_DUPLICATE_CALENDAR
description: Creates a new, empty google calendar with the specified title (summary).

summary.description: Title for the new Google Calendar to be created. If an empty string is provided, the calendar will be created without a title.
summary.title: Summary

name: GOOGLECALENDAR_FIND_EVENT
description: Finds events in a specified google calendar using text query, time ranges (event start/end, last modification), and event types; ensure `timemin` is not chronologically after `timemax` if both are provided.

calendar_id.description: Identifier of the Google Calendar to query. Use 'primary' for the primary calendar of the authenticated user, an email address for a specific user's calendar, or a calendar ID for other calendars.
calendar_id.title: Calendar Id

event_types.description: Event types to include: 'default' (regular event), 'focusTime' (focused work time), 'outOfOffice' (out-of-office time).
event_types.title: Event Types

max_results.description: Maximum number of events per page (1-2500).
max_results.title: Max Results

order_by.description: Order of events: 'startTime' (ascending by start time) or 'updated' (ascending by last modification time).
order_by.title: Order By

page_token.description: Token from a previous response's `nextPageToken` to fetch the subsequent page of results.
page_token.title: Page Token

query.description: Free-text search terms to find events. This query is matched against various event fields including summary, description, location, attendees' details (displayName, email), and organizer's details.
query.title: Query

show_deleted.description: Include deleted events (status 'cancelled') in the result.
show_deleted.title: Show Deleted

single_events.description: Expand recurring events into individual instances. If false, returns master recurring events.
single_events.title: Single Events

timeMax.description:
Upper bound (exclusive) for an event's start time to filter by. Only events starting before this time are included. Accepts multiple formats:
1. RFC3339 timestamp (e.g., '2024-12-06T13:00:00Z')
2. Comma-separated date/time parts (e.g., '2024,12,06,13,00,00')
3. Simple datetime string (e.g., '2024-12-06 13:00:00')
timeMax.title: Time Max

timeMin.description:
Lower bound (exclusive) for an event's end time to filter by. Only events ending after this time are included. Accepts multiple formats:
1. RFC3339 timestamp (e.g., '2024-12-06T13:00:00Z')
2. Comma-separated date/time parts (e.g., '2024,12,06,13,00,00')
3. Simple datetime string (e.g., '2024-12-06 13:00:00')
timeMin.title: Time Min

updated_min.description:
Lower bound (exclusive) for an event's last modification time to filter by. Only events updated after this time are included. When specified, events deleted since this time are also included, regardless of the `show_deleted` parameter. Accepts multiple formats:
1. RFC3339 timestamp (e.g., '2024-12-06T13:00:00Z')
2. Comma-separated date/time parts (e.g., '2024,12,06,13,00,00')
3. Simple datetime string (e.g., '2024-12-06 13:00:00')
updated_min.title: Updated Min

name: GOOGLECALENDAR_FIND_FREE_SLOTS
description: Finds free/busy time slots in google calendars for specified calendars within a defined time range (defaults to the current day utc if `time min`/`time max` are omitted), enhancing busy intervals with event details; `time min` must precede `time max` if both are provided.

calendar_expansion_max.description: Maximum calendars for which FreeBusy information is provided. Max allowed: 50.
calendar_expansion_max.title: Calendar Expansion Max

group_expansion_max.description: Maximum calendar identifiers to return for a single group; exceeding this causes an error. Max allowed: 100.
group_expansion_max.title: Group Expansion Max

items.description: List of calendar identifiers (primary ID 'primary', user/calendar email, or unique calendar ID) to query for free/busy information.
items.title: Items

time_max.description: End datetime for the query interval. Accepts ISO, comma-separated, or simple datetime formats.
time_max.title: Time Max

time_min.description: Start datetime for the query interval. Accepts ISO, comma-separated, or simple datetime formats.
time_min.title: Time Min

timezone.description: IANA timezone identifier (e.g., 'America/New_York', 'Europe/London') for interpreting `time_min` and `time_max` if they lack timezone info, and for expanding recurring events.
timezone.title: Timezone

name: GOOGLECALENDAR_GET_CALENDAR
description: Retrieves a specific google calendar, identified by `calendar id`, to which the authenticated user has access.

calendar_id.description: Identifier of the Google Calendar to retrieve. 'primary' (the default) represents the user's main calendar; other valid identifiers include the calendar's email address.
calendar_id.title: Calendar Id

name: GOOGLECALENDAR_GET_CURRENT_DATE_TIME
description: Gets the current date and time, allowing for a specific timezone offset.

timezone.description: Timezone offset from UTC in hours (e.g., 6 for UTC+6, -9 for UTC-9, 5.5 for UTC+5:30). Default 0 is UTC.
timezone.title: Timezone

name: GOOGLECALENDAR_LIST_CALENDARS
description: Retrieves calendars from the user's google calendar list, with options for pagination and filtering.

max_results.description: Maximum number of calendars to return per page. Max 250.
max_results.title: Max Results

min_access_role.description: Minimum access role for calendars returned. Valid values: 'freeBusyReader', 'owner', 'reader', 'writer'.
min_access_role.title: Min Access Role

page_token.description: Token for the page of results to return, from a previous response.
page_token.title: Page Token

show_deleted.description: Include deleted calendars in the result.
show_deleted.title: Show Deleted

show_hidden.description: Include calendars not typically shown in the UI.
show_hidden.title: Show Hidden

sync_token.description: Sync token from a previous list request to get only changed entries; showDeleted, showHidden, and pageToken are ignored if provided.
sync_token.title: Sync Token

name: GOOGLECALENDAR_PATCH_CALENDAR
description: Partially updates (patches) an existing google calendar, modifying only the fields provided; `summary` is mandatory and cannot be an empty string, and an empty string for `description` or `location` clears them.

calendar_id.description: Identifier of the Google Calendar to update; use 'primary' for the main calendar or a specific ID.
calendar_id.title: Calendar Id

location.description: New geographic location of the calendar (e.g., 'Paris, France').
location.title: Location

summary.description: New title for the calendar; cannot be an empty string.
summary.title: Summary

timezone.description: New IANA Time Zone Database name for the calendar (e.g., 'Europe/Zurich', 'America/New_York').
timezone.title: Timezone

name: GOOGLECALENDAR_PATCH_EVENT
description: Updates specified fields of an existing event in a google calendar using patch semantics (array fields like `attendees` are fully replaced if provided); ensure the `calendar id` and `event id` are valid and the user has write access to the calendar.

attendees.description: List of email addresses for attendees. Replaces existing attendees. Provide an empty list to remove all.
attendees.title: Attendees

calendar_id.description: Identifier of the calendar. Use 'primary' for the primary calendar of the logged-in user. To find other calendar IDs, use the `calendarList.list` method.
calendar_id.title: Calendar Id

conference_data_version.description: API client's conference data support version. Set to 1 to manage conference details (e.g., Google Meet links); 0 (default) ignores conference data.
conference_data_version.title: Conference Data Version

description.description: New description for the event; can include HTML.
examples: Weekly team sync meeting to discuss project updates.
description.title: Description

end_time.description: New end time (RFC3339 timestamp, e.g., '2024-07-01T11:00:00-07:00'). Uses `timezone` if provided, otherwise UTC. For all-day events, use YYYY-MM-DD format (exclusive end date).
end_time.title: End Time

event_id.description: Identifier of the event to update.
event_id.title: Event Id

location.description: New geographic location (physical address or virtual meeting link).
location.title: Location

max_attendees.description: Maximum attendees in response; does not affect invited count. If more, response includes organizer only. Must be positive.
max_attendees.title: Max Attendees

send_updates.description: Whether to send update notifications to attendees: 'all', 'externalOnly', or 'none'. Uses default user behavior if unspecified.
send_updates.title: Send Updates

start_time.description: New start time (RFC3339 timestamp, e.g., '2024-07-01T10:00:00-07:00'). Uses `timezone` if provided, otherwise UTC. For all-day events, use YYYY-MM-DD format.
start_time.title: Start Time

supports_attachments.description: Client application supports event attachments. Set to `True` if so.
supports_attachments.title: Supports Attachments

timezone.description: IANA Time Zone Database name for start/end times (e.g., 'America/Los_Angeles'). Used if `start_time` and `end_time` are provided and not all-day dates; defaults to UTC if unset.
timezone.title: Timezone

name: GOOGLECALENDAR_QUICK_ADD
description: Parses natural language text to quickly create a basic google calendar event with its title, date, and time, suitable for simple scheduling; does not support recurring events or direct attendee addition via parameters, and `calendar id` must be valid if not 'primary'.

calendar_id.description: Identifier of the calendar for the event. Use 'primary' for the main calendar, or provide a specific calendar ID (e.g., email address).
calendar_id.title: Calendar Id

send_updates.description: Controls whether email notifications about the event creation are sent to attendees.
send_updates.title: Send Updates

text.description: Natural language input describing the event; Google Calendar parses this for event details like title, date, and time.
examples: Dentist appointment tomorrow at 2pm for 45 minutes
text.title: Text

name: GOOGLECALENDAR_REMOVE_ATTENDEE
description: Removes an attendee from a specified event in a google calendar; the calendar and event must exist.

attendee_email.description: Email address of the attendee to remove; if the email does not match an existing attendee, the event remains unchanged.
attendee_email.title: Attendee Email

calendar_id.description: Identifier of the Google Calendar to which the event belongs; 'primary' signifies the user's main calendar.
calendar_id.title: Calendar Id

name: GOOGLECALENDAR_SYNC_EVENTS
description: Synchronizes google calendar events, performing a full sync if no `sync token` is provided or if a 410 gone error (due to an expired token) necessitates it, otherwise performs an incremental sync for events changed since the `sync token` was issued.

calendar_id.description: Google Calendar identifier; 'primary' refers to the authenticated user's main calendar.
calendar_id.title: Calendar Id

event_types.description: Filters events by specified types (e.g., 'default', 'focusTime', 'outOfOffice', 'workingLocation'). All types returned if omitted.
event_types.title: Event Types

max_results.description: Max events per page (max 2500); Google Calendar's default is used if unspecified.
max_results.title: Max Results

pageToken.description: Token for paginating results, from a previous response's `nextPageToken`.
pageToken.title: Page Token

single_events.description: If True, expands recurring events into individual instances (excluding master event); otherwise, Google's default handling applies.
single_events.title: Single Events

sync_token.description: Token for incremental sync, retrieving only changes since issued. A 410 GONE response indicates an expired token, requiring a full sync.
sync_token.title: Sync Token

name: GOOGLECALENDAR_UPDATE_EVENT
description: Updates an existing event by `event id` in a google calendar; this is a full put replacement, so provide all desired fields as unspecified ones may be cleared or reset.

calendar_id.description: Identifier of the Google Calendar where the event resides. The value 'primary' targets the user's primary calendar.

create_meeting_room.description: If true, a Google Meet link is created and added to the event. CRITICAL: As of 2024, this REQUIRES a paid Google Workspace account ($13+/month). Personal Gmail accounts will fail with 'Invalid conference type value' error. Solutions: 1) Upgrade to Workspace, 2) Use domain-wide delegation with Workspace user, 3) Use the new Google Meet REST API, or 4) Create events without conferences. See https://github.com/googleapis/google-api-nodejs-client/issues/3234
create_meeting_room.title: Create Meeting Room

description.description: Description of the event. Can contain HTML. Optional.

event_duration_hour.description: Number of hours (0-24). Increase by 1 here rather than passing 60 in `event_duration_minutes`

event_duration_minutes.description: Number of minutes (0-59). Make absolutely sure this is less than 60.
event_duration_minutes.title: Event Duration Minutes

event_id.description: The unique identifier of the event to be updated.
event_id.title: Event Id

guestsCanInviteOthers.description: Whether attendees other than the organizer can invite others to the event.

guestsCanSeeOtherGuests.description: Whether attendees other than the organizer can see who the event's attendees are.

guests_can_modify.description: If True, guests can modify the event.
guests_can_modify.title: Guests Can Modify

location.description: Geographic location of the event as free-form text.

recurrence.description: List of RRULE, EXRULE, RDATE, EXDATE lines for recurring events.
recurrence.title: Recurrence

send_updates.description: Defaults to True. Whether to send updates to the attendees.
send_updates.title: Send Updates

start_datetime.description: Naive date/time (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS) with NO offsets or Z. e.g. '2025-01-16T13:00:00'
start_datetime.title: Start Datetime

timezone.description: IANA timezone name (e.g., 'America/New_York'). Required if datetime is naive. If datetime includes timezone info (Z or offset), this field is optional and defaults to UTC.
timezone.title: Timezone

If an empty string is provided, the document will be created with only the title.

include_trashed.title: Include Trashed

order_by.title: Order By

# Document Title

This is a paragraph with **bold** and *italic* text.

- Unordered list item 1
- Unordered list item 2

1. Ordered list item 1
2. Ordered list item 2

An image: ![Alt text for image](https://www.example.com/image.png)

## Advanced Markdown


# Example Python code
def greet(name):
    print(f'Hello, {name}!')
greet('World')


| Column A | Column B |
|----------|----------|

|   Data 3 |   Data 4 |

> This is a blockquote.

ONLY use if the file is a native Google Workspace format; specifying it is highly recommended for successful export. MUST be omitted for non-Google Workspace files (e.g., PDFs, images), which are downloaded in their native format.

name: GOOGLEDRIVE_EDIT_FILE

name: GOOGLEDRIVE_FIND_FILE
description: Searches for files and folders in google drive using various criteria; `modified after` timestamp must be in utc rfc3339 format.

full_text_contains.description: Searches file content for this text (case-insensitive).

full_text_not_contains.description: Excludes files whose content contains this text (case-insensitive).
full_text_not_contains.title: Full Text Not Contains

mime_type.description: Filters files by a specific MIME type (e.g., 'application/vnd.google-apps.document' for Google Docs, 'application/pdf' for PDF files).

modified_after.description: Filters for files modified after this UTC RFC3339 timestamp (e.g., '2023-01-01T00:00:00Z').

name_not_contains.description: Excludes files whose names contain this string (case-insensitive).

page_size.description: The maximum number of files to return per page. Must be at least 1.

supports_all_drives.description: Indicates if the application supports searching 'My Drive' and shared drives. Must be true if 'include_items_from_all_drives' is true.

description: Finds folders in google drive by applying all specified search criteria using 'and' logic.

name_contains.description: A substring to search for within folder names. This search is case-insensitive.

starred.description: Set to true to search for folders that are starred, or false for those that are not.

mime_type.title: Mime Type

name: GOOGLEDRIVE_UPLOAD_FILE

name: GOOGLESHEETS_AGGREGATE_COLUMN_DATA

name: GOOGLESHEETS_BATCH_GET
description: Retrieves data from specified cell ranges in a google spreadsheet; ensure the spreadsheet has at least one worksheet and any explicitly referenced sheet names in ranges exist.

ranges.description: A list of cell ranges in A1 notation (e.g., 'Sheet1!A1:B2', 'A1:C5') from which to retrieve data. If this list is omitted or empty, all data from the first sheet of the spreadsheet will be fetched. A range can specify a sheet name (e.g., 'Sheet2!A:A'); if no sheet name is provided in a range string (e.g., 'A1:B2'), it defaults to the first sheet.
ranges.title: Ranges

spreadsheet_id.description: The unique identifier of the Google Spreadsheet from which data will be retrieved.
spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id

description: Updates a specified range in a google sheet with given values, or appends them as new rows if `first cell location` is omitted; ensure the target sheet exists and the spreadsheet contains at least one worksheet.

parameters.description: Request to update a range of cells or append new rows in a Google Sheet with specified values.

first_cell_location.description: The starting cell for the update range, specified in A1 notation (e.g., 'A1', 'B2'). The update will extend from this cell to the right and down, based on the provided values. If omitted, values are appended to the sheet.
first_cell_location.title: First Cell Location

includeValuesInResponse.description: If set to True, the response will include the updated values from the spreadsheet.
includeValuesInResponse.title: Include Values In Response

sheet_name.description: The name of the specific sheet within the spreadsheet to update.
sheet_name.title: Sheet Name

spreadsheet_id.description: The unique identifier of the Google Sheets spreadsheet to be updated.
spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id

valueInputOption.description: How input data is interpreted. 'USER_ENTERED': Values parsed as if typed by a user (e.g., strings may become numbers/dates, formulas are calculated); recommended for formulas. 'RAW': Values stored as-is without parsing (e.g., '123' stays string, '=SUM(A1:B1)' stays string).
valueInputOption.title: Value Input Option

values.description: A 2D list of strings for cell values. Each inner list represents a row. Ensure columns are properly aligned across rows.
values.title: Values

description: Creates a new column in a google spreadsheet, requiring a valid `spreadsheet id` and an existing `sheet id`; an out-of-bounds `insert index` may append/prepend the column.

If false (default), it inherits from the column immediately to its right (the succeeding column). This is ignored if there is no respective preceding or succeeding column.

description: Appends a single content block to a notion page or a parent block (must be page, toggle, to-do, bulleted/numbered list, callout, or quote); invoke repeatedly to add multiple blocks.

Defines the parameters for fetching data (pages and/or databases) from Notion.
Exactly one of `get_pages`, `get_databases`, or `get_all` must be set to true to specify the type of data to retrieve.

properties.description:
Property values for the new page. IMPORTANT: This field requires a LIST of objects, not a dictionary. Each object in the list defines a property and must include: `name` (the exact name of the property as it appears in Notion), `type` (the property's data type), and `value` (the property's value, formatted as a string according to its type).

CORRECT FORMAT EXAMPLE (a list of property objects):
[
  {"name": "Title", "type": "title", "value": "My new task"},
  {"name": "Status", "type": "select", "value": "In Progress"},
  {"name": "Tags", "type": "multi_select", "value": "Work,Personal"},
  {"name": "Due Date", "type": "date", "value": "2024-06-01T12:00:00.000-04:00"},
  {"name": "Completed", "type": "checkbox", "value": "False"}
]

INCORRECT FORMAT (e.g., a dictionary instead of a list):
{
  "Title": "My new task",
  "Status": "In Progress"
}

Value formatting rules by property type:
- `title` or `rich_text`: Plain text string (maximum 2000 characters).
- `number`: String representation of a number (e.g., "23.4").
- `select`: The name of an existing option for the select property (e.g., "In Progress").
- `multi_select`: Comma-separated string of existing option names (e.g., "Work,Personal").
- `date`: ISO 8601 formatted date string (e.g., "2024-06-01T12:00:00.000-04:00").
- `people`: Comma-separated string of Notion user IDs.
- `checkbox`: String "True" or "False".
- `url`: A valid URL string.
- `files`: Comma-separated string of URLs.
Properties defined in the database schema but omitted from this list will be initialized with default or empty values. Ensure that property names and types correctly match the target database schema.

type.description: Type of the property. Type of the propertytitle, rich_text, number, select, multi_select, date, people, files, checkbox url, email, phone_number, formula, created_by, created_time, last_edited_by, last_edited_time
type.title: PropertyType

value.description:
Value of the property, it will be dependent on the type of the property
For types --> value should be
- title, rich_text - text ex. "Hello World" (IMPORTANT: max 2000 characters, longer text will be truncated)
- number - number ex. 23.4
- select - select ex. "India"
- multi_select - multi_select comma separated values ex. "India,USA"
- date - format ex. "2021-05-11T11:00:00.000-04:00",
- people - comma separated ids of people ex. "123,456" (will be converted to array of user objects)
- url - a url.
- files - comma separated urls
- checkbox - "True" or "False"
value.title: Value
